jparsec.astronomy

Class TelescopeElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.TelescopeElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class TelescopeElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to hold and to calculate the properties of a telescope. Calculations are based on theoretical statements, so the real life could be somewhat different. This instance allows to attach a camera (CCDElement), but this should be done only with a null ocular (OcularElement). The method attachCCDCamera(CCDElement) is recommended to change between visual and CCD modes. You can also use CCDElement directly for quick calculations, including those unsupported here like having an ocular between the telescope and the CCD camera.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Width of the spiders in mm in Newton telescopes.

      • ocular

        public OcularElement ocular
        Ocular object.

      • ccd

        public CCDElement ccd
        CCD camera attached to the telescope instead of an ocular. To be used this value must be non null and ocular must be null;

      • cromatismLevel

        public float cromatismLevel
        Level of cromatism, from 0 (null) to a recommended maximum value of 2 (medium-high). A level of 2 is defined as a cromatism where the distance between the red and the blue rays are about 2 arcseconds.

      • invertHorizontal

        public boolean invertHorizontal
        True if the telescope inverts the image from East-West.

      • invertVertical

        public boolean invertVertical
        True if the telescope inverts the vision from North-South.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TelescopeElement

        public TelescopeElement()
        Creates a default TelescopeElement with no information.

      • TelescopeElement

        public TelescopeElement(java.lang.String n,
                int focal,
                int diam,
                int obstruction,
                int spiders,
                float cromatism,
                OcularElement ocl)
        Creates a Telescope object by giving the values of the fields. The invert horizontal/vertical flags are set automatically using the name of the telescope. For catadioptric telescopes invertHorizontal is set to true, supposing you are looking using the diagonal mirror. For Newtonians and refractors both invertHorizontal and invertVertical are set to true, supposing you are not using an erecting prism.
        Parameters:
        n - Name of the telescope.
        focal - Focal length of the telescope in mm.
        diam - Diameter in mm.
        obstruction - Central obstruction in mm.
        spiders - Secondary spiders width in mm.
        cromatism - Cromatic aberration level, from 0 to 5.
        ocl - Ocular object.

      • getTelescopesFromExternalFile

        public static TelescopeElement[] getTelescopesFromExternalFile(java.lang.String jarfile,
                                               java.lang.String jarpath,
                                               FileFormatElement[] fmt)
                                                        throws JPARSECException
        Return all telescopes from an external file. Designed specially for input file scope.txt in sky.jar.
        Parameters:
        jarfile - Name of the jarfile.
        jarpath - Path to the file.
        fmt - File format array with telescope name as NAME, diameter in mm as DIAMETER, and focal ratio as F.
        Returns:
        Array of Telescope objects.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.
        See Also:
        FileFormatElement

      • getPrimaryFocusField

        public double getPrimaryFocusField()
        Returns the angular field of view diameter at prime focus.
        Returns:
        The angular field in radians.

      • getField

        public double getField()
                throws JPARSECException
        Returns the angular field of view diameter with the current ocular. In case a camera is attached (and ocular is null) the returned value will be the field of view of the camera in the x axis. For both null camera and ocular the primary focus field is returned.
        Returns:
        The angular field in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getOcularFocalLengthForCertainField

        public static float getOcularFocalLengthForCertainField(double field,
                                        TelescopeElement telescope)
        Returns the ocular focal length to obtain certain field of view in a given telescope. The ocular object is required
        Parameters:
        field - Desired field of view in radians.
        telescope - Telescope.
        Returns:
        The adequate ocular focal length in mm, or 0 if the telescope has no ocular defined.

                        throws JPARSECException

        Returns:
        Magnification factor.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance for a null ocular.

      • getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane

        public double getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane(double angRadius)
        Returns the size of an object at film plane in primary focus mode. This calculation is done for old 35 mm films, for digital cameras you have to correct by multiplying by sensor size (mm) and dividing by 35.
        Parameters:
        angRadius - Angular radius of the object in radians.
        Returns:
        Size in mm.

      • getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane

        public double getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane(double angRadius,
                              float barlowX)
        Returns the size of an object at film plane with a given Barlow lens. This calculation is done for old 35 mm films, for digital cameras you have to correct by multiplying by sensor size (mm) and dividing by 35.
        Parameters:
        angRadius - Angular radius of the object in radians.
        barlowX - Amplification factor of the Barlow lens used, 2 for 2x, and so on.
        Returns:
        Size in mm.

      • getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane

        public double getObjectSizeAtFilmPlane(double angRadius,
                              double distToFocalPlane)
        Returns the size of an object at film plane in eyepiece projection mode.
        Parameters:
        angRadius - Angular radius of the object in radians.
        distToFocalPlane - Distance to focal plane in mm.
        Returns:
        Size in mm.

      • getLimitingMagnitude

        public double getLimitingMagnitude()
        Returns the approximate limiting magnitude of the telescope. Returned value is for optical observations even in case a CCD camera is attached.
        Returns:
        Limiting magnitude.

      • getCCDLimitingMagnitude

        public double getCCDLimitingMagnitude(double s,
                             double sb,
                             double rn)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Returns the approximate limiting magnitude of the telescope with a CCD camera attached. Based on the original program in BASIC by Bradley E. Schaefer in "Limiting Magnitudes for CCDs", Sky and Telescope page 117 of the May 1998 issue.
        Parameters:
        s - Exposure time in seconds.
        sb - Sky brightness in mag/s^2. A good value is 19. Typical values are between 16 and 24.
        rn - Readout noise in e- per pixel. Typical values for good CCDs and DLSR cameras are around 7.
        Returns:
        Limiting magnitude, defined as the magnitude for which the signal to noise ratio will be around 3 for the input exposure time.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getResolution

        public double getResolution()
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the theoretical resolution of the telescope in optical wavelengths. In case a CCD camera is attached the resolution per pixel is returned.
        Returns:
        Resolution in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getResolution

        public double getResolution(double lambda)
        Returns the theoretical resolution of the telescope for a given wavelength, using the Dawes limit. Returned value is for visual observations, not affected in case a camera is attached.
        Parameters:
        lambda - wavelength in microns. For optical wavelengths you can use 0.55 microns, resulting in slightly lower resolution compared to getResolution().
        Returns:
        Resolution in radians, set as 1.22 * wavelength / diameter.

      • attachCCDCamera

        public void attachCCDCamera(CCDElement ccd)
        Attaches a given CCD camera to this telescope. The ocular is set to null to allow the camera to operate in this instance, unless the input CCD camera itself is null. In the latter case the previous ocular is recovered.
        Parameters:
        ccd - The CCD camera to attach, or null.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
